title: Energy Ottawa website navigation font
content:
Hello

I sent this to Mike Yanega and he recomended I post it here.

I am having a very hard time trying to identify the font type used on my company website. We are making some changes/updates and the original web design company, in a display of sour grapes, is not telling us what font this is, because they want to do all the updating work.

[Click here for a sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20090517085055/http:/www.energyottawa.com/_images/english/inside/green/t_green_generation.gif) or [Click here for the full website](http://web.archive.org/web/20090517085055/http:/www.energyottawa.com/green_power/index.cfm?dsp=template&act=view3&template_id=46&lang=e)

Any help anybody can provide in identifying this font would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks

Tim
author: MrTimV

comments.content: Very close... the numbers (specifically 4) is different and the M is a bit more condensed... other then that though its very accurate... I don’t think you’d be able to tell much difference.

Discovered, as I was going through... there is no characters that also have the accents/special characters used in languages like french.

I kinda need those, any idea where/if I can get those for a similar font?

’Digital’ _( ’ [Digital Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20090517085055/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/digital-sans/)’ )_, _may be an alternate, containing these_..

_( I would have linked to FontShop, but all I got, instead of fontshop.com, was.: ’Server Error / The server encountered an internal error and was unable to complete your request / Could not connect to JRun Server’.. Similar errors seem to occur pretty regularly, recently.. Anyone else noticed.? )_
